text: Four vessels of the United States Navy have been named USS Charlotte, after the city of Charlotte, North Carolina. * was a Confederate schooner captured by Federal forces in 1862 and used until 1867. * was the armored cruiser North Carolina renamed in 1920, a year before decommissioning. * was a patrol frigate used by the United States Coast Guard during World War II. * is a nuclear-attack submarine commissioned in 1994. ==Sources== * * Category:United States Navy ship names
title: USS Charlotte
